data.title: Armia
data.meta_description: Armia (English: Army) is a Polish punk rock band founded in 1985 by Tomasz Budzyński, Sławomir Gołaszewski and Robert Brylewski. data.text:
Armia (English: Army) is a Polish punk rock band founded in 1985 by Tomasz Budzyński, Sławomir Gołaszewski and Robert Brylewski. Armia is famous for its use of horn, which was unusual of punk rock bands in late 1980s and 1990s. With poetic (often inspired by philosophy and literature) lyrics, written by Budzyński, and evolving, creative music Armia has gained popularity and respect over the years, and its concerts now attract numerous fans of rock music.

[]

Peel played one of the band's tracks, 'Na Ulice', of a punk compilation called, 'Jak Punk To Punk', and one further play of their b-side from their single 'Aguirre' followed.

Shows Played[]

1987

16 September 1987: Na Ulice (v/a LP - Jak Punk To Punk) Tonpress

1988

24 February 1988: Na Ulice (v/a LP - Jak Punk To Punk) Tonpress

1989

11 May 1989: Saluto (7" - Aguirre) Tonpress

[]
